location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Ext 2446/47 'Observance of celebrations in Persian Gulf'

physicalDescription.extent: The file's contents are arranged in approximate chronological order from the rear to the front of the file.

Foliation: the foliation sequence (used for referencing) commences at the front cover with 1, and terminates at the inside back cover with 8, these numbers are written in pencil, are circled, and are located in the top right corner of the recto side of each folio.

mods.abstract: This file consists of letters and telegrams between the Secretary of State for Commonwealth Relations, London, and the Political Resident in Persian Gulf regarding the arrangement of different celebrations in Persian Gulf.Related matters of discussion include the following: Celebration of Armistice Day, Remembrance Day and New Year.The file includes a divider which gives the subject number, the year the subject file was opened, the subject heading, and a list of correspondence references by year. This is placed at the back of the correspondence.

name.namePart: Secretary of State for Commonwealth Relations
